items.content:
The subject of this double period is relatives.

  • Form groups of three or four pupils.

Discuss the following questions in your group:

  • Where do your grand-parents live?
  • How many uncles and aunts do you have?
  • Where do your relatives live?
Step activiteit
activity		 leerdoel
aim		 tijd
time
introduction Find out what you already know. 10
Step 1 listening
Family		 You can understand questions about relatives and answer them. 15
Step 2 reading
Family and families		 You can understand a text about relatives and answer questions. 15
Step 3 vocabulary You can understand and use vocabulary about relatives. 15
Step 4 grammar
nouns and plurals 		You can use nouns and plurals. 15
Step 5 speaking
Speech card		 You can have a conversation about your relatives. 10
Step 6 writing
An email about your relatives		 You can write an email about your relatives. 15
Step 7 evaluation Reflecting on what you have learnt. 05

Family

You are going to listen to ten questions about relatives.

  • Listen to the recording.
  • While listening, think about the folllowing question:
    • Welke van de vragen zou je nu al in het Engels kunnen beantwoorden? Probeer ze ook daadwerkelijk te beantwoorden in de pauzes tussen de vragen.

Now do the exercises.

introduction.body: Listen again. For each question that you hear, choose the correct answer.

prompt.body: What is the best answer to question number 1?
What is the best answer to question number 2?

content.body: Five: my parents, me and my two sisters.
My father has a brother and two sisters.
I have a brother and two sisters.

prompt.body: What is the best answer to question number 3?
What is the best answer to question number 4?
What is the best answer to question number 5?
What is the best answer to question number 6?
What is the best answer to question number 7?
What is the best answer to question number 8?

content.body: We've been married for five years.
We got married on a beach in Spain.
We had a beautiful summer wedding.

prompt.body: What is the best answer to question number 9?
What is the best answer to question number 10?

content.body: We met at a Christmas party.
My wife and I got married in May.

items.content:
Assignment 3
Listen again to the recording and repeat the questions

prompt.body: So what does your father do for a living?
How many .... are in your family?

content.body: There are five people in my family.

prompt.body: How .... is your .... ?

content.body: We met at a Christmas party.
My wife and I got married in May

items.content:
Family and families
Before you start reading the text, discuss the following questions with a classmate.

  • How important is family for you?
  • Would you miss them if you lived far away?
  • Now read the following text and answer the questions.

I don't live with my parents now because I'm married and live in New York. My mum and dad live in Rome and my husband's parents live in Montreal, Canada. We are a little sad because we don't see them a lot but when we get together we have a beautiful time.

One of my sisters lives in Rio, Brazil, and the other one, who is 16, is at home in Rome. My husband has only one brother. He is at home in Montreal. Next year he wants to go to Paris to study European history.
We got married one year ago in Rome.

All my family and his family were at the wedding. We had a fantastic time, and our honeymoon in Venice was beautiful. We would like to have a son and a daughter. We hope they'll have a beautiful life, maybe in America, maybe in Africa or Asia or Europe.

prompt.body: Is the writer a man or a woman?
Where does the writer live?
Where do the writer's parents live?
Where does the writer's brother-in-law want to go?
Where did the writer get married?
How many children has the writer got?

items.content:
1. Would you like to be the writer?
  2. Would you like your family to live far away from you?
  3. Why or why not?
  4. Write down your answer in five lines.

To be able to do all the assignments correctly, you need to know some words and sentences.
For each theme there are word lists ready in StudioWozzol, with which you can practice:

Vocabularylist Relatives
  • Study the vocabulary. (10 minutes)
  • Do the exercise.

Tip!
There are many ways to study vocabulary. You can read the words aloud or copy them. The most important rule is never to spend more than 10 minutes studying words. Every minute you spend longer is a waste of time.

content.body:
Fill in the correct word.

Choose from:
a lot - brothers or sisters - children - for a living - honeymoon - husband - live - married - one year ago - our family - parents - two daughters - wedding - work

  1. Would you like to get ?
  2. Where would you like to go on ?
  3. Would you like to have a big or a small ?
  4. How many would you like to have?
  5. I would like to have .
  6. We all went to Paris with my sister's .
  7. In there are only three people.
  8. That is because I don't have any .
  9. What would you like to do ?
  10. I don't know what kind of I would like to do.

items.content:
Zelfstandige naamwoorden en meervoud.
These are the links from the 'Kennisbank Engels'.

Zelfstandig naamwoord

Meervoud


Now, do the following exercises:

content.body:
Lees de zinnen.
Zoek steeds het zelfstandig naamwoord op.

  1. That book is over there.
  2. I want a new bike.
  3. I live in an apartment.

Lees de zinnen.
Zoek steeds het zelfstandig naamwoord op.

  1. The house is very beautiful.
  2. The weather is nice.
  3. I have a lot of clothes.

Lees de zinnen.
Zoek steeds het zelfstandig naamwoord op.

  1. The rabbit is eating.
  2. Laila lives there.
  3. We have a black sofa at home.

Lees de zinnen.
Zoek steeds het zelfstandig naamwoord op.

  1. I like cycling to school.
  2. I'm going to school tomorrow.
  3. Have you learned well for the test?

Lees de zinnen.
Zoek steeds het zelfstandig naamwoord op.

  1. I like big cities.
  2. It costs a lot to stay at luxury hotels.
  3. He has a bad temper.

Lees de zinnen.
Zoek steeds het zelfstandig naamwoord op.

  1. She teaches young children.
  2. My schoolbag is very heavy.
  3. Every day I come home early.

items.content:
Speech cards
Expressions: If you need some extra help, go to your StudioWozzol account and take another look at the chunks.
Now you are going to try to have a conversation with someone else.

  1. Find someone to work with and use the speech card A or B on page two.
  2. Write down a couple of words to help you during the conversation.
  3. Practise your conversation at least twice.

After practising twice, do the following things:

  1. Find another pair to work with.
  2. Act out your conversation.
  3. Let them act out their conversation and write down feedback for them.
  4. Let them do the conversation and write down feedback for them.
  5. Discuss what things were good and what you can do better next time.
    Persoon A Persoon B
    1 Groet. 1 Groet.
    2 Vraag de naam van de ander. 2 Geef antwoord.
    Vraag de naam van de ander.
    3 Geef antwoord. Vraag hoeveel broers de andere heeft 3 Geef antwoord. Vraag hoeveel zussen de ander heeft.
    4 Geef antwoord. Vraag naar de grootouders van de ander wonen. 4 Geef antwoord. Vraag waar andere familieleden van de ander wonen.
    5 Geef antwoord. 5 Stel een zelf bedachte vraag.
    6 Geef antwoord. Stel een zelfbedachte vraag. 6 Geef antwoord.
    7 Beëindig het gesprek. 7 Reageer en sluit af.

An email about your relatives.
You are going to write an email to your pen pal from London.
Use the following prompts:

  • Say hello to your pen pal (think of a name).
  • Decide about who you are going to write: your grand-parents or uncles or aunts.
  • Give information about them (what do they look like, age, work ?)
  • Tell where they live.
  • Tell how often you visit them.
  • Tell what you do when you visit them.
  • Think of a question you could ask your pen pal.
  • Ask your pen pal to write about his/her relatives.
  • End your email.

What have you learnt in this double period?
Answer the following questions:

  • What was the easiest part of this lesson?
  • What did you already know?
  • What was the most difficult part?
  • What was new to you in this lesson?
  • What do you have to ask your teacher?
